election_record.label: New Hampshire 1802 U.S. House of Representatives

overview.note: Most newspaper results only list votes by ticket, not by individual candidates.
"Scattering votes, principally Federal, 1337." The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH). September 30, 1802.
"The whole number of candidates was 62." Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH). October 5, 1802.

"There were also votes from several towns, which were not returned and certified according to law, and therefore not included in the above number - Federal, 1046 - Demo. 393." The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH). September 30, 1802.
Gilsom, Marlboro, Packersfield, Stoddard, Sullivan and Surry combined for 377 votes for the Federalist ticket and 3 votes for the Republican ticket.
The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH) lists the Federalists as the Washington ticket and the Republicans as the Jefferson ticket.

Because most newspapers only listed the votes by tickets, the town votes in Cheshire County, Grafton County and Hillsborough County exceed the listed total in these counties for Thomas Cogswell. It is likely that many of the votes were instead cast for Obed Hall.

sub_unit.name: Keene
sub_unit.note: The United States Oracle, and Portsmouth Advertiser (Portsmouth, NH), Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH) and New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 54 votes.

sub_unit.name: Marlborough
sub_unit.note: The Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH) reports 75 votes for the Federalist ticket in Marlborough.

sub_unit.name: Richmond
sub_unit.note: The New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) lists the Federalist ticket with 1 vote.

sub_unit.name: Rindge
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH) lists the Federalist ticket with 87 votes and the Republican ticket with 23 votes; these are the same results initially listed in the Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH), which would be corrected in a later issue.

sub_unit.name: Walpole
sub_unit.note: The New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH), September 4, United States Oracle, and Portsmouth Advertiser (Portsmouth, NH), September 11, and the The Virginia Gazette, and General Advertiser (Richmond, VA), September 18, report 52 votes for the Republican ticket in Walpole.

sub_unit.name: Grafton
sub_unit.note: The Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH), September 18, reports 34 votes for the Federalist ticket and 4 votes for the Democratic ticket in Grafton.

sub_unit.name: Hanover
sub_unit.note: The Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH) and the Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH) list Samuel Hunt with 98 votes, Clifton Claggett with 97 votes, Silas Betton with 97 votes and David Hough with 97 votes.

sub_unit.name: New Chester
sub_unit.note: The Virginia Gazette, and General Advertiser (Richmond, VA), September 18, reports 1 vote for the Democratic ticket in New Chester.

sub_unit.name: Piermont
sub_unit.note: The United States Oracle, and Portsmouth Advertiser (Portsmouth, NH) and The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 13 votes.

sub_unit.name: Rumney
sub_unit.note: The Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH), September 18, reports 59 votes for the Federalist ticket and 6 for the Democratic ticket in Rumney.
The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), September 21, reports 59 votes for the Federalist ticket and 13 for the Republican ticket in Rumney.

sub_unit.name: Amherst
sub_unit.note: The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH) lists the Republican ticket with 96 votes.

sub_unit.name: Bedford
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH) and New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 72 votes and the Republican ticket with 9 votes.

The Republican Ledger, and Portsmouth Price Current (Portsmouth, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 33 votes and the Republican ticket with 30 votes.

sub_unit.name: Derryfield
sub_unit.note: The Republican Ledger, and Portsmouth Price Current (Portsmouth, NH), September 7, New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH), September 11, United States Oracle, and Portsmouth Advertiser (Portsmouth, NH), September 11, and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH), September 11, report 11 votes for the Federalist ticket and 8 for the Republican ticket in Derryfield.

sub_unit.name: Dunbarton
sub_unit.note: "In Dunbarton and Hopkinton, the Federal ticket prevailed." The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH). September 9, 1802.

sub_unit.name: Litchfield
sub_unit.note: The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH) lists the Federalist ticket with 76 votes and the Republican ticket with 6 votes.
The New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) lists the Federalist ticket with 70 votes.

sub_unit.name: New Ipswich
sub_unit.note: The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH) lists the Federalist ticket with 117 votes.

The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH), The Virginia Gazette, and General Advertiser (Richmond, VA) and New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 103 votes.
The Dartmouth Gazette lists the Federalist ticket with 111 votes.

The Republican Ledger lists the Federalist ticket with no votes and the Republican ticket with 107 votes. This appears to be one of several reversals that were corrected in a later issue without any of the towns being specified.

sub_unit.name: Warner
sub_unit.note: "It is said the Democratic ticket prevailed in Warner." The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH). September 9, 1802.

sub_unit.name: Weare
sub_unit.note: The New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) lists the Federalist ticket with 5 votes.

sub_unit.name: Wilton
sub_unit.note: The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH) lists the Federalist ticket with 37 votes and the Republican ticket with 41 votes.

The Republican Ledger lists the Federalist ticket with 33 votes and the Republican ticket with 30 votes. This appears to be one of several reversals that were corrected in a later issue without any of the towns being specified.
The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) lists the Federalist ticket with 32 votes and the Republican ticket with 30 votes.

sub_unit.name: Bow
sub_unit.note: "It is said the Democratic ticket prevailed in Bow." The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH). September 9, 1802.

sub_unit.name: Brentwood
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), Republican Ledger, and Portsmouth Price Current (Portsmouth, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 35 votes.

sub_unit.name: Deerfield
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), Republican Ledger, and Portsmouth Price Current (Portsmouth, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 25 votes and the Republican ticket with 98 votes.

sub_unit.name: Epping
sub_unit.note: The New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) lists the Federalist ticket with 43 votes.

sub_unit.name: Exeter
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), Republican Ledger, and Portsmouth Price Current (Portsmouth, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 90 votes.

sub_unit.name: Greenland
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), Republican Ledger, and Portsmouth Price Current (Portsmouth, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 6 votes and the Republican ticket with 49 votes.

sub_unit.name: New Castle
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), Republican Ledger, and Portsmouth Price Current (Portsmouth, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list the Federalist ticket with no votes.

sub_unit.name: Newmarket
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), Republican Ledger, and Portsmouth Price Current (Portsmouth, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 36 votes and the Republican ticket with 71 votes.

sub_unit.name: North Hampton
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), Republican Ledger, and Portsmouth Price Current (Portsmouth, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 33 votes.

sub_unit.name: Nottingham
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), Republican Ledger, and Portsmouth Price Current (Portsmouth, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 17 votes.

sub_unit.name: Pembroke
sub_unit.note: "It is said the Democratic ticket prevailed in Pembroke." The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH). September 9, 1802.

sub_unit.name: Pittsfield
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH), The Virginia Gazette, and General Advertiser (Richmond, VA) and New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 53 votes.

sub_unit.name: Dover
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), Republican Ledger, and Portsmouth Price Current (Portsmouth, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 30 votes and the Republican tickets with 63 votes.

The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH), The Virginia Gazette, and General Advertiser (Richmond, VA), and New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 31 votes and the Republican ticket with 61 votes.

sub_unit.name: Gilmantown
sub_unit.note: The Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH), September 18, reports 84 votes for the Federalist ticket and 3 for the Democratic ticket in Gilmantown.

sub_unit.name: Milton
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH), The Virginia Gazette, and General Advertiser (Richmond, VA) and New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) list the Republican ticket with 1 vote.

sub_unit.name: Sanbornton
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH) and United States Oracle, and Portsmouth Advertiser (Portsmouth, NH) list the Federalist ticket with 91 votes.
The Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH) lists the Republican ticket with 17 votes.
